headline: Sausage and Shrimp Gumbo
description: This classic Cajun dish with sliced smoked sausage, shrimp, bell peppers and okra in a rich broth is ladled into bowls over rice.

video.description: See what smoked sausage does to a savory, spicy Cajun classic.
video.name: Sausage and Shrimp Gumbo

name: Sausage and Shrimp Gumbo
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) package Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage
0.5 pound large raw shrimp, peeled, deveined
3 cups hot cooked long-grain white rice

recipeInstructions.text: Cut sausage into 1/2-inch slices; set aside.

Combine flour and oil in a 4 quart heavy saucepan; mixing until smooth. Cook and stir over medium-high heat 3 minutes. Reduce heat to medium; cook and stir 6-8 minutes or until roux is a dark reddish brown.
Stir in onion, bell peppers, celery, okra and garlic; cook and stir 8-10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in Cajun seasoning.
Stir in chicken broth; bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Reduce heat to low; stir in sausage, pepper sauce, black pepper and salt to taste. Simmer, covered 15 minutes. Remove cover.
Bring to a boil; add shrimp and cook 3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink.
Ladle gumbo into bowls with rice.

review.reviewBody: People need to understand that the darker the roux, the less thickening power it will have. I cook the roux to a LIGHT brown to remove the taste of raw flour because I enjoy a creamier gumbo.
Good basic gumbo recipe. I added some fire roasted tomatoes which really helped the flavor.
Perfect
Made it with only a teaspoon or so of Cajun seasoning. I think it's better with more. Also used a can of diced tomatoes and no pepper sauce, also used Spanish rice. It was very good.
Just made it but no okra ,was great will definitely do it again.
this was easy to follow and turned out great

This was enjoyed by the whole family. Made as directed, it was a little soupy. And, I felt it needed more hot sauce and Cajun seasoning. I will make this again with a little more roux base. Loved all the veggies!
Made this tonight! It was good but a little too spicy for us. I will cut spices back next time I make it. My husband and I do not like too spicy foods.
Good gumbo. Added some thyme and a bay leaf. Switched out okra for asparagus. Everybody loved it and I will definitely make it again
It was good! A more mild flavor and not too spicy. My guests enjoyed it!
GREAT BASIC RECIPE! easy to make nd delicious. I used all fresh ingredients and seasoned with what we like. Yum!
Delicious. Quick and easy.

This is very delicious!
I did add more spice and doubled the amount of rue.
I will definitely make this again.

I added a little cornstarch to thicken it up and a tiny splash of root beer extract to give it the filé powder taste. I used Creole seasoning instead of Cajun seasoning but added just a very tiny amount of cayenne pepper. A little spicy but it didn’t overpower it. Great recipe with fried green tomatoes and honey cornbread!
this is my fave and the sausage was a success
Becoming my new comfort food, swapped okra with cauliflower rice and sausage with turkey sausage.
So good! doubled the recipe and it came out perfectly!!!

I didn't have any celery so I added corn cut off the cob (2) and leftover boiled red potatoes diced, 2 cans of chicken broth 15 oz., prepared diced garlic about 3 Tblsp, My husband doesn't like rice very much so I just let it cook down a little and we ate it as a pretty thick soup or stew. It was Great!

I added half a pound of chicken cut into cubes (2 pieces fit on a spoon). I put it in with the veggies but left out the okra. I doubled the cajun seasoning. Plan on making it again on our next snow day.
Yum! I left out hot sauce and added 1t seasoning salt and 1/4t gumbo file. Will definitely make again!
We loved this! I added a can of diced tomatoes and another teaspoon of Cajun seasoning. Loved how easy it was compared to the half day versions. Thank you!
I love this recipe!!

Just got done eating a bowl of this gumbo I followed the recipe except I used an andulle sausage made locally at Costanzas sausage didn’t add any salt and used a jalapeño instead of the pepper sauce i also browned up the sausage in a fry pan to give it some color before boiling it with the rest of the ingredients. it was wonderful very tasty will definitely make this dish again.
Absolutely Delicious! The kids and hubby loved it!!
First time I've ever made a roux or gumbo and it turned out amazing! Will definitely make this again and again, especially when shrimp is in season! Pairs up well with corn muffins.
No changes
Substituted andouille sausage for smoked for a bit of a kick and served with brown rice. Otherwise followed recipe as written. Wonderfu! Be ready for the kick. It's a keeper.

This was pretty good! I'm not a huge gumbo fan, but made it for my husband. He loved it and I really liked it. He had another recipe to use, but I couldn't find it so went to my trusted all recipes website. We had a can of stewed tomatoes and tomato sauce to use for his recipe. I decided to had half of each just to give this gumbo more flavor and color. In my opinion it might have been a bit bland without the added tomato. Otherwise, great recipe and I'll make it again some day :).
We love spicey! This was perfect for a cold snowy day. Only thing I changed is that I added 2 more cups of water (we like to have some broth with our gumbo) and added a chopped tomato.

Great gumbo. Easy to make and tasted great. You can adjust the amount of spice with less Cajun sea song and hot sauce. I used what was recommended and it had a good amount of kick. But I like spicy. I didn’t substitute or leave out any of the ingredients and pretty much followed the recipe to a T.
Did not make any changes & will most DEFINITELY be making this again!
Fast and fabulous! I added a can of diced tomatoes and a can of lump crab meat. Served over jasmine rice. A big hit!
Excellent recipe overall, only I subbed andouille sausage for authenticity.

I make this every couple of months I love it so much!! I'm not a stickler to the measurements but I follow the recipe pretty well. It's always a hit in my home. And the neighbors really enjoy the leftovers.
This is really good and so easy to make. Definitely on my saved list of exceptional gumbo
This was really tasty. I increased the broth to 5 cups and added a can of diced tomatoes. Nice level of heat with the seasoning in the recipe.
I’ve never made gumbo and this was great! I added a teaspoon of tapatio for an extra kick. I didn’t use shrimp but it still turned out wonderful.

Loved this! The house smelled great! I only had shrimp on hand so I doubled the amount of shrimp to make up for the absence of sausage. I substituted the cayenne for 1 teaspoon chili garlic sauce and used chicken bullion with water instead of chicken broth. Vegetables were cooked a little to long for my liking, but overall great dish!

Definitely making it again. It was so good. I made it as directed except I put in only half the spices called for. I knew I'd have some guests here that wouldn't like that much spice. The hot sauce was put on the table for those who wanted it hotter.
Amazing flavor, easy to make with little time involved. Veggie preps easily done ahead of time.
Delicious!!! Used Andouille sausage and substituted yellow pepper for the green and couple shakes of Cayenne pepper instead of hot sauce as we didn't have any :) Will definitely make again.
I followed the recipe exactly, except I used andouille sausage, and my husband and I loved it! Would definitely make this over and over again.
I left out the okra, and it tasted very good

Fantastic recipe! I omitted the green pepper and instead added fresh corn - cut off 2 ears and 2 fresh tomatoes, peeled with seeds removed. Also I used all natural smoked chicken sausage with Italian seasoning. It is spicy enough without the pepper sauce; it's good to let each person add as they need. Will definitely make again.

The roux was flavorless. I kept adding more Cajun spice. But it never really flavored it very well. I tasted the seasoning and it tasted like it was right but I don't think I will make this recipe again.

GREAT gumbo! this one will be added to the regular staples menu for sure. 
some fairly insignificant mods that just felt right: 
-used EV olive oil/quinoa flour for rue. 
-doubled the garlic (can never have too much garlic!)
-used nitrate free spicy beef andouille sausage & sauteed for a few minutes ahead of time in evoo/garlic on med-high heat to get a good sear (b/c i prefer anything in the hot dog family burned at least a little). 
-used a little more broth than called for for added soupage
-added a couple diced jalapeños.
-used chili garlic cholula for the pepper sauce
-seasoned up the cooked rice with s/p, cholula, splash of worcestershire just before serving
It was very easy to make. Well written instructions. I omitted the red pepper only because I didn't have one, and added a can of tomato, okra, and corn (drained). It all worked out nicely.
Delicious! Omitted okra. Cooked the roux for 30 minutes for a rich broth. Hot sauce on table for individual use but not in cooking. Husband is Cajun and he loved it. Will certainly make again.
I have to agree, not a big fan of boiling sausage but when put together with all the other ingredients, it was fab!

We really liked this! I followed the recipe very closely. My only deviation was to cut the hot pepper sauce to 1/4 teaspoon, and this was enough heat for us. Though the roux took a few minutes more than the recommended time to develop its color, it provided richness and complexity that was very satisfying.
